title: South Korean Conservative Defeat and Quest for Rebirth
content:
South Korea's conservatives suffered a massive defeat in a recent snap presidential election. The result gave the ruling Democratic Party, led by Lee Jae-myung, control of both parliament and the presidency.

This defeat was heavily linked to the smouldering resentment over former President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed martial law declaration in December. The attempt at military rule led to Yoon's removal from office and the conservative People Power Party's (PPP) eventual loss.

A key factor in the defeat was the PPP's inability to overcome divisions within the right and unify behind a single candidate. The PPP's candidate, Kim Moon-soo (41.15%), was unable to convince Lee Jun-seok (8.34%) of the minor Reform Party to drop out, splitting the conservative vote. Lee Jae-myung won with 49.42%.

Lee Jun-seok, a controversial figure who had previously led the PPP and helped Yoon win in 2022 before being ousted, suggested the PPP should have focused on reform over unity.

Infighting during the primary process, including clashes between Kim Moon-soo and then-acting President Han Duck-soo, further damaged the party. Kim apologized for the "nonsensical" candidate selection process.

Critics pointed to the PPP's failure to fully distance itself from Yoon's unpopular martial law. Political commentator Park Sangbyoung noted the party sided with "far-right ideas" and nominated Kim Moon-soo, who had ties to far-right groups, failing to attract moderate voters.

Following the loss, conservative leaders are blaming each other as they seek a new direction. PPP floor leader Kweon Seong-dong stepped down, calling the defeat a "painful reprimand" for the party's internal divisions and urging a complete rebuild.
There are calls for radical change. Some suggest the conservatives need to be reborn, possibly even "blowing up the party and creating a new one" to be a true opposition force. Professor Shin Yul attributed the "falling of People Power Party" to leadership focused on self-interest and said they must "clear the mess inside". Lawmaker Park Jeong-hoon stated the party must "tear down our house and rebuild it" for survival.

Yoon is the second consecutive conservative president removed from office, following Park Geun-hye's impeachment in 2017. Internal conflict also followed Yoon's impeachment, with then-PPP leader Han Dong-hoon's plan for an interim government being rejected, causing further division.

Han Dong-hoon urged cooperation with the new administration on some issues but stressed resistance against any attempt to "destroy the judiciary system". The PPP accuses the Democratic Party of trying to pass bills to shield President Lee Jae-myung from corruption charges. Han called this the "last chance to end the same old politics".

units.unit: in a recent snap presidential election

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 한국의 보수 진영은 최근의 조기 대선에서 엄청난 패배를 겪었다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: South Korea's conservatives suffered a massive defeat in a recent snap presidential election

units.unit: the ruling Democratic Party, led by Lee Jae-myung,
control of both parliament and the presidency

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 그 결과는 이재명이 이끄는 집권 민주당에게 의회와 대통령직 모두의 통제권을 안겨주었다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: The result gave the ruling Democratic Party, led by Lee Jae-myung, control of both parliament and the presidency

units.unit: over former President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed martial law declaration in December
units.detail: 지난 12월 윤석열 전 대통령의 실패한 계엄령 선포에 대한

analysis.originalSentenceText: This defeat was heavily linked to the smouldering resentment over former President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed martial law declaration in December

the PPP's inability to overcome divisions within the right and unify behind a single candidate

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 패배의 핵심 요인은 우파 내 분열을 극복하고 단일 후보 중심으로 단결하지 못한 국민의힘의 무능력이었다.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Lee Jun-seok, a controversial figure who had previously led the PPP and helped Yoon win in 2022 before being ousted, suggested the PPP should have focused on reform over unity

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 김문수와 당시 한덕수 대통령 권한대행 간의 충돌을 포함한 경선 과정에서의 내분은 당을 더욱 손상시켰다.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Kim apologized for the "nonsensical" candidate selection process

units.unit: the PPP's failure to fully distance itself from Yoon's unpopular martial law

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 비판가들은 국민의힘이 윤 전 대통령의 비인기 계엄령으로부터 완전히 거리를 두지 못한 실패를 지적했다.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Political commentator Park Sangbyoung noted the party sided with "far-right ideas" and nominated Kim Moon-soo, who had ties to far-right groups, failing to attract moderate voters

analysis.originalSentenceText: Following the loss, conservative leaders are blaming each other as they seek a new direction

units.unit: , calling the defeat a "painful reprimand" for the party's internal divisions and urging a complete rebuild

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 국민의힘 원내대표 권성동은 사퇴하며, 그 패배를 당의 내분에 대한 "고통스러운 질책"이라 부르고 완전한 재건을 촉구했다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: PPP floor leader Kweon Seong-dong stepped down, calling the defeat a "painful reprimand" for the party's internal divisions and urging a complete rebuild

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 급진적인 변화에 대한 요구들이 있다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: There are calls for radical change

units.unit: the conservatives need to be reborn, possibly even "blowing up the party and creating a new one" to be a true opposition force

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 일부는 보수 진영이 진정한 야당 세력이 되기 위해 재탄생해야 하며, 아마도 "당을 폭파하고 새 당을 만드는 것"까지도 필요하다고 제안한다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Some suggest the conservatives need to be reborn, possibly even "blowing up the party and creating a new one" to be a true opposition force

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 신율 교수는 "국민의힘의 몰락"을 사리사욕에 집중한 지도부 탓으로 돌렸고, 그들이 "내부의 혼란을 정리해야 한다"고 말했다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Professor Shin Yul attributed the "falling of People Power Party" to leadership focused on self-interestand said they must "clear the mess inside"

units.unit: the party must "tear down our house and rebuild it" for survival

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 박정훈 의원은 당이 생존을 위해 "우리의 집을 허물고 다시 지어야 한다"고 말했다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Lawmaker Park Jeong-hoon stated the party must "tear down our house and rebuild it" for survival

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 윤 전 대통령은 2017년 박근혜의 탄핵에 이어, 직위에서 물러난 두 번째 연속적인 보수 대통령이다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Yoon is the second consecutive conservative president removed from office, following Park Geun-hye's impeachment in 2017

units.unit: , with then-PPP leader Han Dong-hoon's plan for an interim government being rejected, causing further division
units.detail: 당시 국민의힘 대표였던 한동훈의 임시 정부 구성 계획이 거부되면서, 추가적인 분열을 야기하며

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 내부 갈등은 또한 윤 전 대통령의 탄핵 이후에도 뒤따랐는데, 당시 국민의힘 대표였던 한동훈의 임시 정부 구성 계획이 거부되면서 추가적인 분열을 야기했다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Internal conflict also followed Yoon's impeachment, with then-PPP leader Han Dong-hoon's plan for an interim government being rejected, causing further division

units.unit: cooperation with the new administration on some issues

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 한동훈은 몇몇 사안에 대해 새 행정부와의 협력을 촉구했지만, "사법 체계를 파괴하려는" 어떠한 시도에 대한 저항을 강조했다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Han Dong-hoon urged cooperation with the new administration on some issuesbut stressed resistance against any attempt to "destroy the judiciary system"

units.unit: of trying to pass bills to shield President Lee Jae-myung from corruption charges

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 국민의힘은 민주당이 이재명 대통령을 부패 혐의로부터 보호하기 위한 법안을 통과시키려 한다고 비난한다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: The PPP accuses the Democratic Party of trying to pass bills to shield President Lee Jae-myung from corruption charges

units.unit: the "last chance to end the same old politics"

analysis.translatedSentenceText: 한동훈은 이것을 "구태 정치를 끝낼 마지막 기회"라고 불렀다.
analysis.originalSentenceText: Han called this the "last chance to end the same old politics"

title: South Korea President Lee's election law violation hearing postponed indefinitely
content:
South Korea President Lee's election law violation hearing postponed indefinitely, court says.

SEOUL, June 9 (Reuters) - A Seoul court said on Monday it will indefinitely postpone a trial of President Lee Jae-myung on charges of violating election law in 2022.
South Korea's Supreme Court ruled in May, before Lee was elected, that Lee had violated election law by publicly making "false statements" during his 2022 presidential bid, and sent the case back to an appeals court

The Seoul High Court, which had scheduled a hearing for the case on June 18, said on Monday that it will postpone the hearing "to be decided later" without a date, a court spokesperson confirmed.

Lee's office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
The court said its decision to postpone the hearing was due to "Constitution Article 84", without elaborating.
South Korea's Constitution, Article 84, says a sitting president is "not subject to criminal prosecution while in office" for most crimes.
However, legal experts are divided on whether that applies to ongoing trials that were already prosecuted before a president was elected.
The National Court Administration under the Supreme Court gave as its opinion that judges of each court where Lee's trials are being held will have to decide whether to stop or proceed, according to its statement to a lawmaker in May.

"The court in charge of hearing the case will determine whether Article 84 of the Constitution should be applied to a criminal defendant who was elected in the presidential election," the statement said.
Lee's ruling Democratic Party, which controls parliament, is planning to pass a bill this week which suspends ongoing trials for the incumbent president, local broadcaster KBS reported on Monday.
The Constitutional Court may be asked to rule whether the bill is unconstitutional, legal experts have said.

analysis.originalSentenceText: South Korea President Lee's election law violation hearing postponed indefinitely, court says.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 이재명 대한민국 대통령의 선거법 위반 공판이 무기한 연기되었다고 법원이 밝혔다.

units.unit: South Korea President Lee's election law violation hearing
units.meaning: 이재명 대한민국 대통령의 선거법 위반 공판이

analysis.originalSentenceText: A Seoul court said on Monday it will indefinitely postpone a trial of President Lee Jae-myung on charges of violating election law in 2022.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 서울의 한 법원은 월요일, 2022년 선거법 위반 혐의로 기소된 이재명 대통령의 재판을 무기한 연기할 것이라고 밝혔다.

units.unit: it will indefinitely postpone a trial of President Lee Jae-myung on charges of violating election law in 2022
units.meaning: 명사절(목적어); 2022년 선거법 위반 혐의로 기소된 이재명 대통령의 재판을 무기한 연기할 것이라고

units.unit: a trial of President Lee Jae-myung
on charges of violating election law in 2022

title: 샘플 학습 콘텐츠 2: 기술 동향
content: AI is rapidly changing the tech industry. Many companies are investing in this field.

analysis.originalSentenceText: AI is rapidly changing the tech industry.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: AI는 기술 산업을 빠르게 변화시키고 있습니다.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Many companies are investing in this field.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 많은 회사들이 이 분야에 투자하고 있습니다.

title: 샘플 학습 콘텐츠 3: 환경 보호
content: Climate change is a global issue. We need to protect our planet.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Climate change is a global issue.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 기후 변화는 전 지구적 문제입니다.

title: 샘플 학습 콘텐츠 4: 건강한 생활
content: Regular exercise is important for your health. A balanced diet also helps.

analysis.originalSentenceText: Regular exercise is important for your health.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 규칙적인 운동은 당신의 건강에 중요합니다.

title: 샘플 학습 콘텐츠 5: 여행 계획
content: I am planning a trip to France next month.

analysis.originalSentenceText: I am planning a trip to France next month.
analysis.translatedSentenceText: 저는 다음 달에 프랑스로 여행을 계획하고 있습니다.
